intro: Helipterum pterochaetum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Helipterum pterochaetum is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed areas.
